ACT
15.  
Third order intestate successors
Third order intestate successors are the grandparents of the bequeather and their descendants.
If at the time of opening of a succession all the grandparents are alive, they succeed to the entire estate in equal shares.
If by the time of opening of a succession a paternal or maternal grandparent is deceased, his or her descendants replace him or her. If he or she has no descendants, the other grandparent on the same side succeeds to his or her share. If the other grandparent is also deceased, his or her descendants succeed.
If by the time of opening of a succession both paternal or maternal grandparents are deceased and they have no descendants, the grandparents on the other side or their descendants succeed.
Upon replacement of parents by their descendants, the provisions concerning first order successors apply.
